Hit Points.Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + Constitution modifier per bard level after 1st

Proficiencies.Weapons: Simple weapons, hand crossbows, longswords, rapiers, shortswords
Proficiencies.Tools: Three musical instruments of your choice

Equipment: (a) a rapier, (b) a longsword, or (c) any simple weapon
(a) a diplomat's pack or (b) an entertainer's pack
(a) a lute or (b) any other musical instrument

Spellcasting.Cantrips: You know two cantrips of your choice from the bard spell list. Learn additional cantrips at higher levels.
Spellcasting.Spell Slots: The Bard table shows how many spell slots you have to cast bard spells. You regain all expended spell slots after a long rest.
Spellcasting.Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher: You know four 1st-level spells of your choice from the bard spell list. Learn more spells and replace them as you gain levels.
Spellcasting.Spellcasting Ability: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for bard spells. Use Charisma for spell save DC and attack rolls.
Spellcasting.Ritual Casting: You can cast any bard spell you know as a ritual if it has the ritual tag.
Spellcasting.Spellcasting Focus: You can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Bardic Inspiration.Description: Use a bonus action to choose a creature within 60 feet who can hear you. The creature gains a Bardic Inspiration die (d6).
Bardic Inspiration.Uses: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum once). Regain expended uses after a long rest.
Bardic Inspiration.Die Progression: Die becomes d8 at 5th level, d10 at 10th level, and d12 at 15th level.

Jack of All Trades.Description: Add half your proficiency bonus to any ability check that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

Song of Rest.Description: Use soothing music to help allies regain hit points during a short rest. Extra hit points increase at higher levels.

Magical Inspiration (Optional).Description: If a creature with Bardic Inspiration casts a spell that restores hit points or deals damage, they can roll the Bardic Inspiration die to add to the spell's effect.

Bard College.Description: At 3rd level, choose a bard college which grants features at 3rd, 6th, and 14th levels.

Expertise.Description: Choose two skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check using those proficiencies.
Expertise.Additional Expertise: At 10th level, choose two more skill proficiencies.

Ability Score Improvement.Description: At levels 4, 8, 12, 16, and 19, increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1.

Bardic Versatility (Optional).Description: Replace a skill for Expertise or replace a cantrip learned from this class with another from the bard spell list.

Font of Inspiration.Description: Regain all expended uses of Bardic Inspiration when you finish a short or long rest.

Countercharm.Description: Use musical notes or words to disrupt mind-influencing effects. Provides advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed.

Magical Secrets.Description: Choose spells from any class. Learn two additional spells at 14th and 18th levels.

Superior Inspiration.Description: When you roll initiative and have no uses of Bardic Inspiration left, regain one use.
